a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Number of payloads and rocket bodies in space, by orbit
Debris from launches or collisions is not counted. Objects are subtracted from the time series after they have reentered
Data source: United States Space Force (2023)
Note: Low Earth orbit is defined by a point of closest approach to Earth below 2,000 kilometers; medium Earth orbit between 2,000 and
35,586 kilometers; geostationary orbit between 35,586 and 35,986 kilometers; high Earth orbit above 35,986 kilometers.
